column1: Sequels: none I don’t know what the future holds for us, but I know that it won’t be easy. [SEP] After growing up the way we did, how could I ever expect it to be? [SEP] But we survived. column3: through until I began the journey for myself. [SEP] But that’s another story. [SEP] All I know now is how I work through everything, day to day. [SEP] What tomorrow will bring, will come. [SEP] And I will push on. [SEP] And I will not be alone. [SEP] NaNoWriMo Novel: Ch.4 [SEP] Last Class

column1: [SEP] Alice had never been happy being the daughter of two of the Days. [SEP] She regarded them- her parents, and all the days, in fact- with a semblance of disdain. [SEP] The night was the only thing that interested her. [SEP] She was secretive. [SEP] Two days before her 13th birthday, her parents, Dawn and Morning Tea, as she called her mother, took her to the Wayward Diviner, as was customary for children of the Days. [SEP] The Wayward Diviner had no doubt in his mind. [SEP] He told Alice’s parents who she was to be the heir of as soon as they walked through the door. [SEP] But they didn’t believe him. [SEP] They told him to spin the Bone Wheel, so they could see for themselves. [SEP] They thought he had made a mistake. [SEP] The Diviner makes no mistakes. [SEP] Thirteen times the wheel
column3: round, only to confirm his words. [SEP] Alice was the Midnight Heir.

column1: “Its gonna be just fine, hun,” my mother insited on the way to my new school. [SEP] I bet you heard this a million times before, i just came to a new town, blah blah, new school, no friends, but i felt like the town of Marzark was way different than the others. [SEP] After I arrived to my dreadful destination I was quickly settled in and rushed into my homeroom. [SEP] “Is he the new kid?”... “He’s cute.” ... “Oh, new kid.” [SEP] Is all I heard while sitting and all eyes were on me. [SEP] But who’s complaining? [SEP] “Hi, I’m Jared.” [SEP] He stretched out his arm, apparently wanting me to shake it. [SEP] I just looked at him, and we both laughed. [SEP] Who shakes hands? [SEP] Its too formal. [SEP] After that everything else
column3: great. [SEP] Jared introduced me to a lot of new friends and some really cool people. [SEP] I was actually starting to love school! [SEP] Well, so far anyway. [SEP] I kept looking for some flaw, but nothing seemed to come up. [SEP] This school was just too perfect! [SEP] After school, Jared invited me to hang out with him.. maybe Marzark wont be so bad. Legend of Rain

column1: Grabbing me by the fin, he swam me to the shore and plopped me down onto the ground. [SEP] I couldn’t breathe. [SEP] He listened to my chest and I blacked out. [SEP] I awoke to his beak touching mine. [SEP] I felt woozy and blacked out – again. [SEP] I woke for the second time in an igloo, but not mine. [SEP] Then I saw him in the kitchen. [SEP] I spoke out. [SEP] “Hello.” [SEP] He spun around and exhaled in relief. [SEP] “Oh, you’re alive!” “Yeah I am, but who are you?” “I can’t tell you.” “Why?” “Because.” [SEP] I got up. [SEP] “I just want to know your name.” “I won’t tell you.” [SEP] I lunged at him and grabbed his throat. [SEP] He punched me, then his whole body became dead weight. [SEP] I let go, and he fell to the ground. [SEP] Dead. [SEP] I killed the penguin of my dreams. [SEP] I
column3: to the wall and bawled my eyes out. [SEP] This can't be healthy.

column1: Sequels: none It took me such a long time, but everything has finally fallen into place. [SEP] The memories I had of him were all memories of when we were going out, when I thought I was in love. [SEP] All I had now were memories. [SEP] There was just one thing. [SEP] Every memory I had only caused me pain to think about. [SEP] Simple solution, right? [SEP] Just don’t think about it. [SEP] But. [SEP] How could you not think about it if it was what made you happy? [SEP] If it was the best few months of your life, wouldn’t you want to remember?Oh, and what sucked the most? [SEP] The ring he gave me for my last birthday?Unhealthily attatched to it!Sure, I tried to take it off. [SEP] I
column3: a good three seconds before hyperventilating and putting it back on my finger. [SEP] I needed to move on. [SEP] I needed to just forget him, because I was dying inside. [SEP] There was just one problem. [SEP] I needed him to breath. [SEP] Without him, I felt so wrong!Every memory that once made me smile now caused the pain in my chest. [SEP] I needed to move on. [SEP] This was surely not healthy for me. [SEP] Or for anyone.. A Compilation of Reasons to Live: Part 1

column1: things have always happened to my family. [SEP] It came in through my mother's blood; my Russian grandmother would always tell me stories, bylichkas, of ancestors with the "second sight", stupid mill owners who discovered bags of gold after letting a special fish off their hooks, and dark strangers who used to appear to help or interfere at crucial times. [SEP] When I asked her if she'd ever seen them – before I was old enough to stop believing, I mean – she would always look sad and tell me, "No, not since the family came to America has anything happened to us. But if you ever should see a faerie, tell him that you are of the blood of Ivan Bogatyrivitch and he will not pass you by so quickly." column1: ow began to flicker, and Isis’ frown of concentration became one of worry. [SEP] The pools in her hands grew deeper. [SEP] Then her fingers tensed and her arms began to shake. [SEP] The blood in her palms, still filling up, began to ripple. [SEP] Shivers swept through her body, and Nepthys reached out to touch her but I stopped him. column1: Questions A veterinarian was feeling ill and
column3: to see her doctor. [SEP] The doctor asked her all the usual questions, about symptoms, how long had they been occurring, etc., when she interrupted him, "I'm a veterinarian and I don't need to ask my patients these kind of questions. I can tell what's wrong just by looking." [SEP] She smugly added, "Why can't you?" [SEP] The doctor nodded, stood back, and looked her up and down. [SEP] He then quickly wrote out a prescription, handed it to her and said, "There you are. Of course, if that doesn't work, then we'll just have to have you put to sleep."

column3: to investigate. [SEP] The next thing she knew, she was hit in the eye and knocked out cold. [SEP] An officer was sent to her house to investigate, and he returned 1-1/2 hours later with a black eye. [SEP] "Did you get hit by the same person?" his captain asked.

column1: A young cook decided that the French would enjoy feasting on rabbits and decided to raise rabbits in Paris and sell them to the finer restaurants in the city. column3: about Paris selling them, a restaurant owner asked him where he got such fresh rabbits. [SEP] The young man replied, "I raise them myself, near the cathedral. In fact, I have ... a hutch back of Notre Dame."

column1: Having arrived at the edge of the river, the fisherman soon realized he had forgotten to bring any bait. [SEP] Just then he happened to see a little snake passing by who had caught a worm. column3: about his fishing. [SEP] An hour or so later the fisherman felt a tug at his pant leg. [SEP] Looking down, he saw the same little snake had come back with three more worms.

column1: Going Down There were these two guys out hiking when they came upon an old, abandoned mineshaft. [SEP] Curious about its depth they threw in a pebble and waited for the sound of it striking the bottom, but they heard nothing. [SEP] They
column3: and got a bigger rock, threw it in and waited. [SEP] Still nothing. [SEP] They searched the area for something larger and came upon a railroad tie. [SEP] With great difficulty, the two men carried it to the opening and threw it in. [SEP] While waiting for it to hit bottom, a goat suddenly darted between them and leapt into the hole! [SEP] The guys were still standing there with astonished looks upon their faces from the actions of the goat when a man walked up to them. [SEP] He asked them if they had seen a goat anywhere in the area and they said that one had just jumped into the mineshaft in front of them!

column1: A lady was walking past a pet store when a parrot said, ''Hey, lady! [SEP] You're really ugly!" [SEP] She was understandably furious and continued on her way. column3: into town for the first time. [SEP] Eventually they ended up in a tall office building. They kept seeing people go in and then come out differently. Finally, the gentleman had enough when he saw an old lady get into the shiny box , the lights flashed on and off again and then a few minutes later a gorgeous blonde stepped out. "Son," he said while panting heavily, "hurry and go get your mother."

column1: If the workforce at large can learn, what are the social arrangements that best sustain new learning? [SEP] Leaving the determination of what is to be learned to a few senior managers? [SEP] Knowing what is best for people or trusting that they might know, or at least contribute to knowing, what is best for themselves? [SEP] Having people trapped by deferred rewards (Williamson, 1975), or acknowledging that those rewards systems are grounded in distrust? [SEP] A colleague recently visited the Czech republic, and explored that country’s relatively rapid adjustment to a market economy. [SEP] She asked what was the single best thing a Czech worker could do to learn the underlying principles of the market. [SEP] ‘Work for McDonalds,’
column3: the surprising reply, ‘but only for six months.’ It was explained that six months was quite long enough for the uninitiated worker to appreciate the importance of customers and customer service. [SEP] After six months, the worker had learned what he or she could and it was time, from a career perspective, to move on. [SEP] The contrast between working for McDonalds for six months or working for McDonalds for a lifetime is, writ large, the contrast between boundaryless careers and their traditional bounded counterparts. [SEP] Today’s work is increasingly ‘intelligent’ work (Quinn, 1992), that calls on workers’ learning capacities, and – as our examples suggest – provides an organising structure rich in project opportunities through which learning episodes can unfold.
